snippet: So-called force-placed insurance is purchased by a lender rather than a homeowner. But the homeowner has to pay for it, and it’s rarely inexpensive. So pay attention.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column welcomes new rules imposed by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau that will regulate force-placed insurance, which is taken out by lenders but paid for by homeowners.
lead_paragraph: So-called force-placed insurance is purchased by a lender rather than a homeowner. But the homeowner has to pay for it, and it’s rarely inexpensive. So pay attention.

headline.print_headline: When the Lender Buys Your Home Insurance, a Call Is in Order
headline.seo: Homeowner Vigilance Needed on Force-Placed Insurance - Wealth Matters
headline.main: When the Lender Buys Your Home Insurance, a Call Is in Order
